Comments_List: This course helped me gain exposure to a variety of research methods that can be utilized in clinical science. I appreciated the opportunities to practice teaching and presenting. I feel like I gained insight into building a program of research and evaluating the methods of others.
I learned so much about the principles of strong inference, statistical methods and presentation of material to a class.

Overall, I thought this was a very strong course. The final R01 assignment helped crystallize many of the topics we covered, however it may also be beneficial for students to write a grant that is more congruent with our stage in training.
The course is optimized to facilitate learning in a variety of domains that are typically not covered in other courses.
Definitely. I think any psychology student would benefit from taking this course. It complements the multivariate statistics requirement very well.
